flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Tools
  • 1 x Android phone (required OS as yet unknown
  • Raspberry Pi running the standard Debian 'squeeze' image

lines.text: You're going to need some kind of MP3 library. Start things off by copying any tracks you want to a folder on either the Pi's own SD card or an external hard drive.
lines.text_raw: You're going to need some kind of MP3 library. Start things off by copying any tracks you want to a folder on either the Pi's own SD card or an external hard drive.

guide.summary: The Raspberry Pi is a nifty gizmo indeed. This project will show you how to set up your Pi to stream MP3s over UPnP to a web interface and, more importantly, to an Android phone.
guide.title: Stream MP3s from Raspberry Pi to Android

tools.text: 1 x Android phone (required OS as yet unknown
Raspberry Pi running the standard Debian 'squeeze' image
